alert.note: Alert for Calvert; St. Marys (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued August 14 at 3:47PM EDT until August 14 at 4:30PM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: The National Weather Service in Sterling Virginia has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southeastern St. Marys County in southern Maryland... Southeastern Calvert County in southern Maryland... * Until 430 PM EDT. * At 347 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over White Point Beach, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Damaging winds will cause some trees and large branches to fall. This could injure those outdoors, as well as damage homes and vehicles. Roadways may become blocked by downed trees. Localized power outages are possible. Unsecured light objects may become projectiles. * Locations impacted include... Lexington Park, Leonardtown, Piney Point, Tall Timbers, Town Creek, Saint Marys City, Saint Marys River, White Point Beach, California, Patuxent River Naval Air Station, Dameron, Valley Lee, Great Mills, Redgate, Drayden, Saint Inigoes, Park Hall, and Callaway. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will send your report to the National Weather Service office in Sterling Virginia. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
